document.docAuthor: Ornosa, Concepción, Torres, Félix & Rúa, Pilar De La
document.masterDocTitle: Updated list of bumblebees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) from the Spanish Pyrenees with notes on their decline and conservation status

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updated list of bumblebees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) from the Spanish Pyrenees with notes on their decline and conservation status

subSubSection.paragraph:
Orophilous subspecies that occurs at the northern half of the Iberian Peninsula, between 600 and 2500 m altitude and, at present, it has been collected in Pyrenean temperate oceanic forest pastures and peatlands, between 1100 m and 2550 m height ( Fig. 7 ), on
Achilegia vulgaris
L.,
Arctostaphylos uva-ursi
(L.),
Asphodellus albus
L.,
Buglossoides arvensis
(L.) I. M. Johns.,
Calluna vulgaris
(L.) Hull.,
Campanula glomerata
L.,
Carduus acanthoides
L.,
Centaurea scabiosa
L.,
Cirsium acaule
(L.) Scop.,
Cirsium arvense
(L.) Scop.,
Cirsium monspessulanum
(L.) Hill,
Cirsium vulgare (Savi) Ten.
,
Cynoglossum officinale
L,
Digitalis purpurea
L.,
Echium plantagineum (Nox.)
,
Echium vulgare L.
,
Epilobium angustifolium
L.,
Eryngium bourgatii Gouan.
,
Gentiana alpina Vill.
,
Gentiana lutea
L.,
Iris latifolia
L.,
Lathyrus pratensis
L.,
Lonicera pyrenaica
L.,
Lotus corniculatus
L.,
Medicago sativa L.
,
Melilotus officinalis
L., Onobrichis vicifolia Scop.,
Phlomis lychnitis
L.,
Prunella vulgaris
L.,
Ranunculus pyrenaeus
L.,
Rhododendron ferrugineum
L.,
Rubus ulmifolius Schott
,
Sempervirum montanum
L.,
Silene acaulis
(L.) Jacq.,
Trifolium pratense L.
,
Trifolium repens L.
,
Vaccinium myrtillus L.
and
Viola odorata L. This
bumblebee is not considered scarce or threatened, its populations seem to be stable or increasing ( Table 2 ), although it exhibits a higher orophilous tendency in the Pyrenees ( Fig. 7 ).
